data.title: Process hang if preferred local display language doesn't support by OS
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Current 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Don't know if this is a bug.
Background: Microsoft banned installing extra language packs on Windows 10 Chinese version.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Change the local display language in locale.json to "en_US"
2. Since there's no language pack supported in the system, processes hang after start
3. Find locale.json and change local display language back to "zh_CN", problem solved.

data.title: Allow an "open with…" in files view
功能建议：文档修改状态的保存
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.52
- OS Version:win8.1

Steps to Reproduce:

 我需要一个简单而常用的功能，就是文档修改状态的保存。
平常随便记录些东西，在关闭时候不要提示我是否保存，如果我不保存，下次打开后仍然可看见编辑的内容，并且可以保存或不保存。 这样的目的是：只要我输入了内容，不管我是否保存都不会丢失（即使断电也不会丢失）。
sublime text是这种方式，这也是我一直用sublime的原因之一。

data.title: VS Code won't open in xrdp session.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2 Linux deb version
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro Insider Preview
- Remote Connection to: Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS Desktop
- Linux xrdp: Xfce-session

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  On Windos 10, open Remote Desktop application
2.  Connect to Linux machine using IP Address provided.
3.  At the Xfec session, click on "Applications | Development | Visual Studio Code"

Results:
Nothing opens

Provide VS Code Verbose results:
maxt@orion:~$ code --verbose
Xlib:  extension "XInputExtension" missing on display ":10.0".
(4:29:39 PM) ### VSCode main.js ###
(4:29:40 PM) /usr/share/code/resources/app { _: [],
  paths: [],
  performance: false,
  verbose: true,
  debugPluginHost: undefined,
  debugBrkPluginHost: undefined,
  logExtensionHostCommunication: false,
  'new-window': false,
  'reuse-window': false,
  goto: false,
  diff: false,
  extensionHomePath: undefined,
  extensionDevelopmentPath: undefined,
  extensionTestsPath: undefined,
  'disable-extensions': false,
  locale: undefined,
  wait: false }
Xlib:  extension "XInputExtension" missing on display ":10.0".
Xlib:  extension "XInputExtension" missing on display ":10.0".

Try Workaround from:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3451
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/9016
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/11873

Changing both '/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libxcb.so.1.1.0' and '/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libxcb.so.1'
information: 's/BIG-REQUESTS/_IG-REQUESTS/' -> Didn't work!

This issue shouldn't be resolved with a workaround. It VS Code should work like JetBrains Python Editor "PC PyCharm" in a xrdp session. 

![pycharm_2016-09-18_18-10-30](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19892435/18619477/8f6267fc-7dcb-11e6-9795-c89446499b68.jpg)

See attached image:
![vscode_notremoting_2016-09-18_17-43-13](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19892435/18619445/896c6b14-7dca-11e6-99c1-57ebdfc2d4a4.jpg)

data.title: Sporadic "contents on disk are newer" issues when saving to network share

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Work a lot on various files stored on a network share.
2. Eventually this will happen. 

Some days it won't happen at all, some days it will happen five times in a row. There appears to be a correlation with network speed / network reliability (lower speed = more errors) but I have also had it happen on very fast connections.

data.title: html tag rename works only on the opening tag but not the closing tag
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6 insider - OS Version: win 10 x64 Steps to Reproduce: ``` 1. Create html like:

hello

2. Double-click on the opening h1 string 3. h1 is selected now 4. start typing 'h' then the autosuggestion gets you h1....h6 5 choose h6 and press enter key 6 the opening tag h1 is now changed to h6 7 the closing tag h1 is still h1 8 please improve ```

data.title: Files copied via file explorer don't show up in editor

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open code in any project with lots of files 
2. go to file explorer
3. copy something via explorer
4. look in code editor: new files do not show up. Even after 10-15min they don't

Only re-opening editor will update files

data.title: Error: Path must be a string. Received null due to some plugin
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0-insider (58d7ff)
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a git project with eslint enabled and then open the change view for a file
2. The error `Error: Path must be a string. Received null` will be shown.

More discussion at https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/711

Restarting vscode with `--disable-extensions` fixes this issue. I think this might be caused
by the eslint server. The stack-trace for the error:

``` js

e.doShow    @   workbench.main.js:94
e.show  @   workbench.main.js:94
(anonymous function)    @   workbench.main.js:105
i.Class.derive._oncancel    @   workbench.main.js:31
t.$showMessage  @   workbench.main.js:104
e.handle    @   workbench.main.js:104
s   @   workbench.main.js:50
f   @   workbench.main.js:50
_combinedTickCallback   @   internal/process/next_tick.js:67
_tickCallback   @   internal/process/next_tick.js:98
```

data.title: VSCode not picking up global/ambient types in node_modules/@types when editing typescript
Workspace setting to open files as read-only/non-editable via editor.
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.5.2
- OS Version:Windows 10

Feature request: Option to allow certain files to be open in the editor only as Read-only.
A workspace settings similar to "files.exclude".

```
"files.readOnly": {       
         "client/src/app/common":true, //Folder
         "server/src/common":true,
         "common/**/*.ts":true //Globs,
         "client/src/app/test.ts":true //Specific file
}
```

With the above settings, a user will not be able to make any changes to the files specified via the editor.

A sample scenario is mentioned in the stack overflow question
[http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39560184/open-certain-files-in-a-workspace-as-read-only-in-vs-code](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39560184/open-certain-files-in-a-workspace-as-read-only-in-vs-code)

data.title: Link highlighting makes it hard to see underscores

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
A link's underline is masking underscore symbols.
Requesting a setting to change link decoration (or to have a link's underline removed while hovering over it).

Having links highlighted in some other way would offer a better overview of link's that have one or more underscores in them.
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 1607

Happened in a JavaScript file: request.get('http://localhost:11590/user/_design/user', next);

data.title: Possibility to display line endings in text area

milestone.title: Backlog

data.body:

- OS Version: Win 7 x64

At the moment there is only the little statusbar menu which display/change the line ending if the actual file. But sometimes it would be great to see the line endings directly in every line (see atom f.e.) especially when there are mixed line endings (not good, but this happens from time to time).

Greetings
Tonka

data.title: `Illegal argument: range` when using `Format Code` with HTML content
data.body:
I've just started to get this error with current insider release. Pretty sure that was not a problem in previous versions.
- VSCode Version: Version 1.6.0-insider (1.6.0-insider) (2016-09-16T06:03:08.867Z)
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6
- extensions disabled by startup option

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  open any properly formatted HTML file (the file should have .html extension)
2.  CMD+SHIFT+P (trigger command pallete) and type `Format Code`

Expected results:
The formatting of the file is changed

Actual results:
The VSCode display Error message:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14539/18616838/466b20fa-7dc3-11e6-9eb1-879a58385c39.png)

The content of developer console:

```
messageService.ts:120 Illegal argument: range
e.doShow @ messageService.ts:120
e.show @ messageService.ts:104
e.resume @ messageService.ts:63
(anonymous function) @ workbench.ts:659
e.invoke @ callbackList.ts:63
e.fire @ event.ts:117
(anonymous function) @ quickOpenController.ts:475
```

Thanks!

data.title: Introduce incremental expression selection

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hi guys, 
This really has a ton of use cases. It allows you to select the expression the cursor is on and with each extra press expand the selection to the containing expression. Say the cursor is on a variable named 'foo' in statement 'bar' in block 'foobar' - it will first select 'foo' then 'bar', then 'foobar', ext... This might be complicated to implement but incredibly useful. :)

data.title: Introduce cursor history navigation
data.body:
Hi guys, love the product!
Would be great to have a command to put the cursor back where the previous edit was made. This is similar to VS history navigation only, I think, better. :)

data.title: Translation fix for Chinese
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 1607

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Ctrl-Shift-X to open extension manager 
2. Click any of the extensions in the list

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19585961/18616037/6f343962-7de7-11e6-9c65-67a697afc4f2.png)

In this case "扩展名" should be "扩展". "扩展" means extension, plugin, etc. while "扩展名" means suffix of filenames e.g. ".txt", ".exe".

This seems to occur only in tabs showing detailed information of extensions.

data.title: Support git-appraise, with a GUI and the appraise format.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: latest
- OS Version: Linux

I can't find a good editor with `git-appraise` support.. and I don't want to start using Eclipse. It's an awesome format and could very well define the future of Code reviews.

https://github.com/google/git-appraise

and the json-schema:

https://github.com/google/git-appraise/tree/master/schema

VS Code would be a great fit for a UI supporting this.

data.title: View state is not restored when part of the editor is folded

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows

When VS Code is started, the scroll position is set to a position that a cursor was put at last time.
And also, when that editor tab is activated again, the scroll position is set to a position of cursor.

I think that the first behavior is useful, but the second makes me confuse sometimes.
For example, when I'm editing a line, I want to see another line. I scroll the editor by using scroll bar because I don't want to move the cursor, and also, I switch the tab to another file.
Now I back to the tab I'm editing, then the scroll position is changed. Here is position of the cursor. It's not the position I set.
